title: Can programming languages like Java be self-taught? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes they can be self taught. If you are new to java programming I would recommend you to go through some online video courses which will definitely help you learn java faster and better. Introduction To Java Courses | CourseraThen websites like tutorial point, beginners for java will help you learn better.Udacity - Free Online Classes & NanodegreesHere you can find java introductory courses and free of cost only you need internet connection and will to learn. I prefer course era beacuse they give you weekly assignments.

Yes.... You don't need to go to any institution.... Follow website like Mysirg.com, Tutorialspoint.com Follow you tube channel Mysirg, thenewboston, telusko etc.. I have completed my core java basics in 20 days from Mysirg.com

Definitely… But you will have to know where to start and follow the badic learning patter you follow with any natural language. Once you are able to map you natural language to equivalent of programming it will be much of a cake walk.

Of course man. I was a beginner to programming and didn't know anything about programming in grade 7. I was determined to learn java or c++ but decided to go for Java as it was in syllabus for grade 9. I didn't have anything but a computer and i read and kept trying until i learned java so much that i could be called a programmer. Now i am in grade 9 and i am the best programmer in my class. I used these sites : Stack OverflowJava TutorialLearn Java - Free Interactive Java TutorialBest of luck for your programming future Cheers.

Yes it can be self-taught. By browsing some online lectures of professors about Java , we can learn it. Check websites like swayam, wikitechy and edx. They have good and proper explained lectures about Java along with assignments
